p.s: Today I read an article about three Modeblogger, who worked, slept and eat in Cambodia, to know more about the seamstresses there.
Because I found this article very interesting, I will explain you what the three bloggerbloggers experienced, felt and which impressions they had after one day in Cambodia.
After few hours of work as a seamstress, they understood, how hard the real life of those people is.
They didn't know, for example, that a seamstress sitsits and dodoes the same thing for hours in a dirty fabric - because the cannot live without working.
They learned, that we are being rich, because those people are poor.
Don't you think, that it is a gigantic problem?
Do you think, that this life can be called a fair trade?
I would be very happy to hear your opinion.
